STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 15, 2021
Savator Selden-Johnson
Kent County DHHS
121 Franklin SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507-1233
RE: License #: CP410201222
Kent County DHHS
121 Franklin SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507-1233
Dear Ms. Selden-Johnson:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
7/8/2021. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and ISEP requirements. It should be noted
that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and your DHHS Policy.
As indicated above substantial compliance has been established therefore, your
certificate of approval license is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly K. Austin, MSW
Child Welfare Licensing Consultant
Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Department of Health and Human Services
121 Franklin St. SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507
Cell (269) 330-7082
Fax (616) 248-1049
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional DHHS Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
Borrowed Bed Files: Orientation and agency agreements can be completed prior to
placement if a suspected placement is to be made. If foster parents are unavailable
on the date of placement to meet to sign documents, they can be provided
electronically but there must be an electronic/documented verbal verification that
they reviewed and agreed to the placement, policies/procedures, etc.
TA: The dates emergency procedures are practiced in the home must be quarterly
and must be documented within the certification renewal and interim reports.
V. CONSULTATION
No consultation was requested or required at the time of the inspection.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The agency is in compliance with the
following:
8/25/2020 INTERIM, CAP Approved 9/2/2020
The agency licenses a small number of foster homes to serve ICPC requests. No
direct case management services are provided by the agency as they are fully
privatized.
Chief Administrator Assessment – I reviewed the Chief Administrator Assessment
dated 7/7/2021 which indicated that the agency has maintained compliance with
child placing agency rules, MISEP, and policy requirements.
4

CHRI - On 7/7/2021 I virtually viewed the storage of the key and the locked storage
area for CHRI information. A cross-shredder was observed in the administration
section of the building for destruction of CHRI when needed.
Other Document Review - On 7/7/2021 I reviewed the agency’s AFPRR,
Organization Chart, and case ratios.
Staff Interviews – There were no concerns presented by staff or administration
during the inspection.
VII. DCWL Field Analyst Concerns
No safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and policy. It is recommended that the
facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
July 8, 2021
__________________ ______________________
Holly K. Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
July 12, 2021
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
